article.name: Change the Phish Alert Text for Microsoft 365 and Hybrid Phish Alert Buttons (PABs)
article.title: Change the Phish Alert Text for Microsoft 365 and Hybrid Phish Alert Buttons (PABs)
article.body:
If you're using the Hybrid version of the Phish Alert Button (PAB) in Outlook 2016 and you would like to add text to the PAB, you are able to.

Changing the Text

Prior to installing the PAB on your mail server, download the O365Manifest.xml, or PhishAlertManifest.xml, file from your KnowBe4 Account Settings.

If you would like to change the PAB text for OWA, open this file in a text editor and edit the following line of text:

If you would like to change the PAB text for Outlook, open the O365Manifest.xml file or PhishAlertManifest.xml file from your KnowBe4 Account Settings.

Important: The PhishAlertManifest.xml file will have two <bt:ShortStrings> sections that will need to be changed for the PAB text to be applied. The first set of strings will be used when your Outlook PAB is in Exchange mode. The second set of strings will be used when you are using Microsoft 365. Any override values will be used for specific locales, and the default values will be used for unsupported locales.

Add your customized PAB text to the DefaultValue text for both the groupLabel and paneReadButtonLabel. Then, save the file and install the PAB as you normally would.

If you've already installed the PAB on your server, you can follow the same steps as above to edit your PAB text. Once your edits are complete, you will need to first, remove your existing PAB add-in from Microsoft 365. Then, add the new .xml file you've edited as an add-in.

Your users will then see the PAB with the custom text you created, as shown in the example below:

If you would like to localize the text of PAB, you can replace the language codes in the DisplayName Override values as shown below. All of the Override Locale sections need to be modified in order for your changes to display. You can find a list of official language identifiers in Microsoft's Language identifiers and OptionState Id values article and a list of ISO codes in the List of ISO 639-1 codes found on Wikipedia.

Please note that the lines of text shown in the above images may vary depending on the number of languages that were added to your PAB instances through our language aware feature. To learn more about the language aware feature for Microsoft 365, please visit our Adding Languages to the Phish Alert Button article.

How to Change the Hover Over Text

To change the Hover Over Text, use the same O365Manifest.xml file or PhishAlertManifest.xml file from your KnowBe4 account settings, open the file in a text editor, and edit the following lines of text:

If you using the PhishAlertManifest.xml file, there are two paneReadSuperTitle strings that need to be updated. The updated override values shown in the image below will apply to supported locales, and the default values will apply to the unsupported locales.

Follow the instructions listed in the Changing the Text section of this article, to enter the replacement text in the DefaultValue for the labels that say "Phish Alert".

The image displays a snippet of a configuration file, likely XML or similar markup, within a source code editor environment (dark theme, syntax highlighting, visible line numbers 9 through 15).

**Context and UI Elements:**
The configuration block defines metadata for an application/service provided by **KnowBe4, Inc**. An orange arrow explicitly points to Line 11.

**Key Configuration Parameters (Lines 9–15):**

*   **Line 9 (ProviderName):** Sets the developer to `KnowBe4, Inc`.
*   **Line 10 (DefaultLocale):** Specifies the default language as `en-US`.
*   **Line 11 (DisplayName):** Sets the application name displayed in the UI to **`Phish Alert V2`**. (This line is visually emphasized by the arrow).
*   **Line 12 (Description):** Sets the detailed product description: `Phish Alert V2 – Report Phishing Emails`.
*   **Line 13 (IconUrl):** Defines the standard icon location via an S3 URL: `https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.knowbe4.com/pab_uploads_prefix/.../icon_64x64.png`. (Part of the path is obscured).
*   **Line 14 (HighResolutionIconUrl):** Defines the high-resolution icon location: `.../icon_128x128.png`. (Part of the path is obscured).
*   **Line 15 (SupportUrl):** Sets the product support link to `https://support.knowbe4.com/`.

This image displays markup language source code, likely XML, within a dark-themed code editor environment (lines 213-244). The context is the definition of short localized strings for a UI component.

**Structure and Content:**

*   The code is contained within the `<bt:ShortStrings>` element.
*   Multiple string definitions (`<bt:String>`) are present, each specifying an `id` and a `DefaultValue`.
    *   **IDs include:** `groupLabel`, `customTabLabel`, `paneReadButtonLabel`, `paneReadSuperTipTitle`, and `phishAlert`.
    *   **Default Values:** All defined strings use `"Phish Alert"` as their `DefaultValue`.
*   Each `<bt:String>` block includes nested `<bt:Override>` elements, defining locale-specific values.
    *   **Locales Covered:** `en`, `en-US`, `ja`, and `ja-JP`.
    *   **Localized Value:** For all visible strings and locales, the defined `Value` is consistently `"Phish Alert"`.

**Annotations:**

Two orange arrows point to the right, specifically highlighting the `DefaultValue="Phish Alert"` attribute on the following elements:

1.  `<bt:String id="groupLabel"...>` (Line 214)
2.  `<bt:String id="paneReadButtonLabel"...>` (Line 226)

images.alt:
This image displays a segment of source code, likely XML or a similar markup language, rendered in a dark-themed code editor (VS Code or similar IDE).

**Context and UI Elements:**

*   **Code Environment:** The background is dark gray/black, using syntax highlighting for clarity.
*   **Line Numbers:** Vertical column on the left displays line numbers (116 through 123).
*   **Focus Indicator:** A prominent orange arrow points directly to line 117.

**Code Details (Lines 116–123):**

The code defines localization strings under the namespace `<bt:String>`.

*   **Line 117 (Targeted):** `<bt:String id="paneReadSuperTipTitle" DefaultValue="Phish Alert">`
    *   This element defines a string with the ID `paneReadSuperTipTitle` and sets its default value to `"Phish Alert"`.
*   **Lines 118–121:** These lines define locale overrides for the string:
    *   `<bt:Override Locale="en" Value="Phish Alert"/>`
    *   `<bt:Override Locale="en-US" Value="Phish Alert"/>`
    *   `<bt:Override Locale="ja" Value="Phish Alert"/>` (Japanese)
    *   `<bt:Override Locale="ja-JP" Value="Phish Alert"/>` (Japanese - Japan)
    *   All specified locales are currently set to the identical value `"Phish Alert"`.
*   **Line 122:** Closing tag for the first string definition: `</bt:String>`
*   **Line 123:** Beginning of a new string definition: `<bt:String id="phishAlert" DefaultValue="Phish Alert">`
